titles.title: Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians Land Transfer Act of 2005
Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians Land Transfer Act of 2005

To transfer certain land in Riverside County, California, and San Diego County, California, from the Bureau of Land Management to the United States to be held in trust for the Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Mrs. Musgrave moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3507.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Public Lands and Forests. Hearings held.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

bill.summary: 11/15/2005--Passed House without amendment. Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians Land Transfer Act of 2005 - Transfers certain land in Riverside and San Diego counties, California, from the Bureau of Land Management to the United States to be held in trust for the Pechanga Band of Luiseno Mission Indians. Allows the transferred land to be used only for the protection, preservation, and maintenance of archaeological, cultural, and wildlife resources.
